conclusion: The p-V image of an ideal gas of a certain mass changes from state A to state B and then to state C. The temperature of the gas in state A is 27°C.
The image is a p-V diagram of an ideal gas, illustrating three states: A, B, and C. The diagram shows the path of the gas from state A to state B and then to state C.
In state A, \( P_A = 1 \times 10^5 \, \text{Pa} \) and \( V_A = 6 \times 10^{-3} \, \text{m}^3 \).
In state C, \( P_C = 3 \times 10^5 \, \text{Pa} \) and \( V_C = 2 \times 10^{-3} \, \text{m}^3 \).

premise: The initial state of the gas is A, where the temperature is given as 27°C.
conclusion: Convert temperature in state A to Kelvin: \( T_A = 27 + 273 = 300 \, \text{K} \).

premise: Using the ideal gas equation of state \( \frac{P_A V_A}{T_A} = \frac{P_C V_C}{T_C} \).
conclusion: Calculate \( T_C \) using \( T_C = \frac{P_C V_C T_A}{P_A V_A} \).
